title: Looking for a slightly modern, slightly decorative type...
content:
Hi all,

I’m currently working on a brief that required a typeface that is quite modern (not overtly so), but has some sort of suggestion of traditional, almost decorative details in its characters/ligatures.

I was having a look at Leitura by the DS type foundry ( [http://www.dstype.com/specimens.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025044608/http:/www.dstype.com/specimens.html "http://www.dstype.com/specimens.html")), but not quite what I’m after...

I understand it may be a confusing question, but any help would be greatly appreciated. Oh, and I don’t mind if I have to add in the decorative elements myself, but it would be nice if the font somewhat suggested them.

Cheers!  
Ben

author: benski

comments.content: If you can explain why Leitura isn’t quite right for you then we can be more helpful.
